page.title: 10Typical Cornish Food
page.content: The Cornish pasty is probably the most famous of all Cornish dishes and it has a long history.For hundreds of years Cornishmen have worked down mines and in that time their wives have developed the art of making pasties.At one time the pasty consisting of meat, potatoes and turnips would be put in one end of a roll of pastry.At the other end their wives would put jam and then cook it all together.In this way the miners would have their dinner and pudding in a convenient, eatable container.Nowadays pasties do not contain jam at one end.There is a saying in Cornwall that you could tell the quality of a pasty by what happened to iy when it was dropped down a mine shaft.If it smashed it was poor;if it bounced it was a real Cornish pasty.
